title: Extreme value theorem
summary: In calculus, the extreme value theorem states that if a real-valued function f {\displaystyle f} is continuous on the closed interval [ a , b ] {\displaystyle [a,b]} , then f {\displaystyle f} must attain a maximum and a minimum, each at least once.
